description:
Move the Windows sandbox to sandbox/win

This is a rather large refactor to move the Windows sandbox to the right place.

BUG=
TEST=
NOTRY=true
TBR=sky@chromium.org

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=147151

messages.text:
Hey Justin,

would you mind me trying to land this now?

There is a little bit of additional complexity because we have 3 "binary" files:
wow_helper/wow_helper.exe
wow_helper/wow_helper.pdb
sandbox_poc/sandbox.ico

And try bots don't handle binary files. So I've cheated a bit to send the try job, with an extra small patch to exclude those files from the build.

So this will need to land without going through the commit queue.
Please run the win and win_rel try jobs as a full clobber. Also, please add cpu in as a reviewer, because we definitely want a second set of eyes on this.

On 2012/07/12 16:58:45, Justin Schuh wrote:
> Please run the win and win_rel try jobs as a full clobber. Also, please add cpu
> in as a reviewer, because we definitely want a second set of eyes on this.

All the trybots have already been run at full clobber. I'm adding "win" now.

On 2012/07/12 17:27:55, Julien Tinnes wrote:
> All the trybots have already been run at full clobber. I'm adding "win" now.

Cool, that runs the debug component builds, which could flush out any remaining issues.

On 2012/07/12 17:50:39, Justin Schuh wrote:
> On 2012/07/12 17:27:55, Julien Tinnes wrote:
> > All the trybots have already been run at full clobber. I'm adding "win" now.
> 
> Cool, that runs the debug component builds, which could flush out any remaining
> issues.

Try success for that job!

Since this CL will deprecate fast, I'm asking OWNER approval ahead of time so that we can then move swiftly.

jam: for content/ and ui/views
sky: for ash/

Looks all mechanical, so lgtm on two very important conditions:

1) Please verify that this preserves the svn history (maybe with @maruel)
2) Please inform the sheriff and babysit the tree when this lands.

On 2012/07/12 22:06:33, Justin Schuh wrote:
> Looks all mechanical, so lgtm on two very important conditions:
> 
> 1) Please verify that this preserves the svn history (maybe with @maruel)

Adding maruel. But I don't think it is possible at all. SVN is too dumb for that. For SVN to understand it, we'd need 1 commit to move, then 1 commit with the modification. But of course the first commit would break the tree, and have an impact on any future bisection.

"git blame" etc should still work though for people using that.

Marc-Antoine, is there another way ?

> 2) Please inform the sheriff and babysit the tree when this lands.
Sure!

On 2012/07/12 23:00:58, Julien Tinnes wrote:
> On 2012/07/12 22:06:33, Justin Schuh wrote:
> > Looks all mechanical, so lgtm on two very important conditions:
> > 
> > 1) Please verify that this preserves the svn history (maybe with @maruel)
> 
> Adding maruel. But I don't think it is possible at all. SVN is too dumb for
> that. For SVN to understand it, we'd need 1 commit to move, then 1 commit with
> the modification. But of course the first commit would break the tree, and have
> an impact on any future bisection.

1. subversion supports that.
2. As I documented ad-nauseum, it is supported by the CQ.
3. Look at any raw diff and you can see the diff is correctly formatted, since it was generated with git, example:
https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/download/issue10689170_1_3034.diff
4. The CQ supports that, as documented.

> "git blame" etc should still work though for people using that.

Yes.

> Marc-Antoine, is there another way ?

It works, you don't need another way.

On 2012/07/13 00:42:25, Marc-Antoine Ruel wrote:
> 1. subversion supports that.
> 2. As I documented ad-nauseum, it is supported by the CQ.
> 3. Look at any raw diff and you can see the diff is correctly formatted, since
> it was generated with git, example:
> https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/download/issue10689170_1_3034.diff
> 4. The CQ supports that, as documented.

Amazing!

Does this mean I should go through the CQ instead of using dcommit to commit via SVN? Try bots won't work (because we're moving binary files), so I should just NOTRY=true but go through the commit queue, is that correct?

Thanks!

On 2012/07/13 00:46:28, Julien Tinnes wrote:
> On 2012/07/13 00:42:25, Marc-Antoine Ruel wrote:
> > 1. subversion supports that.
> > 2. As I documented ad-nauseum, it is supported by the CQ.
> > 3. Look at any raw diff and you can see the diff is correctly formatted, since
> > it was generated with git, example:
> > https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/download/issue10689170_1_3034.diff
> > 4. The CQ supports that, as documented.
> 
> Amazing!
> 
> Does this mean I should go through the CQ instead of using dcommit to commit via
> SVN? Try bots won't work (because we're moving binary files), so I should just
> NOTRY=true but go through the commit queue, is that correct?

Exact.

> Thanks!

Np. I didn't know Justin was anal about svn history. :P

content lgtm. not an owner in ui/views...  in the future, feel free to TBR changes like this, since you're just updating include paths

as for svn history, yes we definitely need to preserve that!
lgtm

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/jln@chromium.org/10689170/26066

Failed to request the patch to try. Please note that binary filesare still unsupported at the moment, this is being worked on.

Thanks for your patience.

HTTP Error 404: Not Found

On 2012/07/13 23:18:43, I haz the power (commit-bot) wrote:
> Failed to request the patch to try. Please note that binary filesare still
> unsupported at the moment, this is being worked on.
> 
> Thanks for your patience.
> 
> HTTP Error 404: Not Found

Marc-Antoine: it looks like even without NOTRY=true I can't use the CQ unfortunately.

err... search?

PS: I might try to land this again on Wednesday which is my "low productivity day".

I don't know, but if we don't, I would rather make that change afterwards, when it's not mega hairy and can't go through try jobs :)

Sure, but it seems like you are already trying to land the patch, and this should be fixed before landing.

Ohh, you're right, my recollection of the timing was wrong. Thanks.

subject: Move the Windows sandbox to sandbox/win
